chargeHist.descr: PTC Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics within 1000 feet of school as repeater (Oxycodone)

result.execSummary:
The defendant James J. SCHACHT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Oxycodone) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

No association with any known drug dealers or users.

No possession of any prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Stipulation and Order Amending Sentence.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant, James Schacht, entered a plea to a count where he was a party to the crime with James Cain.  Mr. Cain is also charged with that count and should be joint and severally liable for the restitution.  Thus, $125.00 of the restitution ordered to be paid by James Schacht should be joint and several with James Cain.

Minutes.
RE:  Deliver Hydrocodone within 1000 feet of school as repeater, on 01-24-14.
Affidavit of Investigator Andrew W. Beck, Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.
At 2:09 p.m. search warrant with return of officer thereon.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of deliver schedule III narcotic within 1000 feet of school, deliver non-scheduled prescription drug and PTC deliver schedule II narcotic within 1000 feet of school.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-12-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash bond with the condition that he have no contact with Jesse Cain.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
